job.title: Systems Engineer III
job.industry: Information Technology and Services,Defense & Space,Aviation & Aerospace
job.description:
Position Summary
MAG Aerospace is looking for a Software Engineer - III to support our customer in creating capabilities and providing technical services and subject matter expertise in Mission Command and C2 Maneuver systems. You will provide primary technical support to the Joint Automated Deep Operations Coordination System (JADOCS) and/or the Advanced Field Artillery Tactical Data Systems (AFATDS).
Duties Include, But Not Limited To
Essential Duties and Responsibilities
Derive and maintain a cohesive program software architecture based on customer requirements, customer interactions, subject matter expert inputs, system architecture artifacts, and business objectives Coordinate with Information Assurance and Risk Management group to design, develop and integrate updated security controls into product source
Communicate development concepts to software developers, program management, and customer representatives during meetings
Work with system engineering personnel to assess requirements, and to ensure consistency between system architecture and software architecture
Use Jira, Confluence, Git/Bitbucket collaboration and source control tools to communicate information
Identify potential roadblocks and develop around them
Plan and estimate development tasks and work to improve performance metrics
Requirements
Minimum Requirements
Knowledge And Skills
US Citizenship and must currently possess an active DoD SECRET security clearance
8-12 years of prior relevant experience
Experience with: Java/J2EE technologies (Sockets, JPA, CML (DOM and SAX parsers)); PostgresSQL (RDBMS, PL/SQL, Referential Integrity); Relational DB models and JPA, Atlassian tools, including Jira, Confluence, and Bitbucket
Ability to multi-task, self-assign work, and function in a dynamic, fast-paced, development environment
Excellent verbal and written skills
Proficiency with MS Office Products (Word, Excel, Visio, & PowerPoint)
Education
BS in technical related degree
Desired Requirements
Experience with Service Oriented Architectures (SOAs) and specifically, OSGi
Experience with AFATDS, Army Common Operating Environment (COE) or other PM MC systems
Experience with Windows scripting (Batch, PowerShell)
Experience with Windows (Processes, IPC, caching, Windows Registry
Other Qualifications
Security related certification or experience in the application of secure programming principals or security controls
Ability to work in office and lab environment
